Practical solutions

for policy problems

The Bennett School of Public Policy opens this autumn. It will develop practical
solutions to urgent policy problems. It is already leading work on 2 key policy
areas: implementation of AI and the revival of post-industrial regions.

Undergraduate

Postgraduate

News


Updates from across the University



News - Genes linked to obesity in Labradors and humans


Researchers at the University of Cambridge have discovered genes linked to obesity in both Labradors and humans. They say the effects can be over-ridden with a strict diet and exercise regime.

News - Aspirin could prevent spread of some cancers


Aspirin is known to slow the spread of some cancers, such as breast, bowel, and prostate cancers. Now scientists have uncovered how it does this. It triggers the immune system and reduces metastasis.

News - Encouraging applications from the North-East


Three Cambridge Colleges teamed up to co-host an event in Newcastle attended by more than 160 students from across North-East England.








Event


Concerts, lectures, sports events, and more



Admissions - Discover Master's and PhD study: Monday 17 to Friday 21 March


Book now for Discover Cambridge, our series of lunchtime webinars exploring the practicalities of applying to postgraduate courses at Cambridge.

Lecture - Where does innovation happen? with Sir Patrick Vallance: Thursday 20 March 2025


Lord Patrick Vallance, Minister of State for Science in the Department for Science, Innovation and Technology, will speak on the topic 'Where does innovation happen?'.

Admissions - Subject Masterclasses: until Thursday 15 May


Explore your chosen subject in greater depth while experiencing typical undergraduate teaching at Cambridge with our Subject Masterclasses.






Student perspectives


Cambridge PhD student Dr Ally Louks went viral last year when she posted a photo of her thesis on the politics of smell in modern and contemporary prose. Here's her story about what happened next,.

Cambridge on Instagram


Dr Layla Ettinghausen graduated from Cambridge last summer. She now works as a Foundation Year 1 doctor. See more of Cambridge's places and people by following us on Instagram. Instagram.
